subject: Re: [nairobilug] AMD Ryzen 5000 and ARM M1 processing chips
body:
On Tue, Dec 29, 2020 at 5:13 AM Bonface Munyoki K. <me@bonfacemunyoki.com> wrote:
Martin Akolo Chiteri <martin.chiteri@gmail.com>
writes:

[...]

> There is a product called Hey! that you might be familiar with. It was
> designed and developed by the creator of Ruby on Rails. Long story short,
> it is supposed to be an "e-mail killer" or at least a rethink of e-mail
> messaging. I signed up for its trial for two weeks and felt that my
> communications needs might not be too sophisticated to justify a $9.99
> monthly subscription fee for the service going forward. Slack had the same
> objectives too https://hey.com/
>

I've just had a look at Hey(!). Does it have IMAP
support. If it doesn't, I can't use it. I use
gnus(https://www.gnus.org/about.html) as my main
email driver; and it has served me well :)

I don't think e-mail will ever be killed. At least
not in our life times. One of the reasons is that
it's the primary driver for some very big impact
project(like the Linux kernel and the Guix project
to name but a few). Even alternatives(like
discourse which is advocated IIR by the Fedora
project) integrate with e-mail, so you could
interact with said platforms from e-mail.

Right, e-mail is the most popular and most widely deployed application on the Internet. E-mail (SMTP) even predates the Web by almost a decade. As you pointed out, e-mail is the backbone of most corporate entities too globally. E-mail is not going anywhere in the foreseeable future.

>>> FWIW, we have gitter, telegram, discord, and IRC
>> >> chatrooms(Please see:
>> >> https://twitter.com/nairobilug/status/1175831229914071041?s=20). I
>> >> hope you were aware of those :)
>> >>
>> > Yes, I am on NaiLUG telegram group and discord server since last weekend.
>> > I was on #IRC but a long time ago (year 2013). I always found IRC clients
>> > on Linux / *BSD a bit clunky. Maybe things have changed since, I may go
>> > back and see.
>> >
>>
>> Great! I'm the /one/ person who uses #IRC
>> lolz. You can ping me from there ;). With IRC, the
>> trick I picked up is to set up QuasselCore on a
>> VPS; and thereafter connect to it from
>> clients. For more, see:
>> https://quassel-irc.org/downloads
>>
>> I am now on #nairobilug
> <https://twitter.com/hashtag/nairobilug?src=hashtag_click> using Hexchat as
> ~chiteri. I'll set up Quassel IRC later, its configuration process seems
> more involved.
>

I see you left. You should generally lurk around
to get any response; or ping.
I will be back later. I have to catch some winks before the day breaks ...

I'm the one "they"
call bonz060 (don't mind doxxing myself here)
\m/\m/

I will be in touch!

Martin.
--
Bonface M. K. D4F09EB110177E03C28E2FE1F5BBAE1E0392253F
Humble GNU Emacs User / Bearer of scheme-y parens
Curator: <https://upbookclub.com> / Twitter: @BonfaceKilz

--
You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "Nairobi GNU/Linux User Group" group.
To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to nairobi-gnu+unsubscribe@googlegroups.com.
To view this discussion on the web visit https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/nairobi-gnu/CAAUkCrO8pkYdDpUnYeV8BS47qmuALra24cu93YKxeaS55FiyiQ%40mail.gmail.com.

subject: Help us budget for 2021
body:
CitizenGO

Arnold,

My staff and I here at CitizenGO headquarters are running out of time.

With 2021 just days away, we are rushing to finalize our activism plans and programs.

And accurate budgeting of our financial resources is a crucial part of that planning.

That’s why I wrote to you with the urgent message below.

But my staff and I haven’t heard back from you yet regarding your decision to make a monthly donation and sustain CitizenGO for 2021.

Please read my message below and agree to your important monthly contribution right away.

I will donate 10€

I will donate 30€

I will donate 80€

I will donate 160€

I will donate 300€

OTHER AMOUNT

Thank you,

Ignacio Arsuaga

--

Here's the email we sent you earlier on this:

Dear Arnold,

This is the time of year that many people reflect on the year that passed and anticipate the one to come.

My team and I at CitizenGO are no different.

Our efforts to defend and promote life, family, and liberty in this difficult 2020 with CitizenGO members like you around the world led to many highs (and a few lows) that you may remember.

Before I review some of what you and I achieved in 2020 -- in spite of the global Coronavirus pandemic that I hope didn’t affect your family -- I want to ask you to support our work for 2021 and beyond by making a one-time donation to CitizenGO. If you say YES, please just click below.

Our continued success depends on our ability to reach millions of people who share our values, to give you (and all CitizenGO members) the voice the political class censors, and the media elites don’t want us to have.

Yes, I will make a one-time donation of: 

I will donate 10€

I will donate 30€

I will donate 80€

I will donate 160€

I will donate 300€

OTHER AMOUNT

As Ann Kioko was explaining in an email just a few days ago, we have overcome tremendous obstacles to obtain lots of extraordinary victories in 2020.

CitizenGO supporters responded to the Coronavirus outbreak with selfless generosity, providing sorely-needed masks and bottled water to hospitals and health workers at the height of the pandemic.

While Coronavirus panic set in, anti-Christian bureaucrats shut down church services and worship in many countries across the globe.

In Spain, they even tried to punish a Catholic Cardinal for simply displaying a beloved icon while worshippers practiced social distancing.

But CitizenGO’s legal and grassroots campaigns halted the efforts to persecute the Cardinal, and were key to allowing worshippers to return to church in Spain, France, the United Kingdom, and elsewhere.

Of course, CitizenGO’s efforts were not limited to merely reacting to events.

Thanks to supporters like you, CitizenGO is empowered to set our own agenda, taking the fight to the far-Left!

CitizenGO’s campaigns helped encourage U.S. President Donald Trump and prime ministers of other nations to withdraw public funding of the United Nation’s notorious World Health Organization (WHO). Our campaign to completely defund its radical gender and pro-abortion agenda continues across the globe.

Not only that, but our worldwide election efforts opposed far-Left candidates, exposing politicians who claim to support our values but instead cower before our political enemies and the media.

In Africa we helped stop bad abortion laws in Kenya, Malawia and Namibia. We also stopped cultural imperialism from well funded pro-abortion organizations across Africa whose main agenda has been to erode the culture of Africans and weakening the family institutions. 

We also protected African children in a number of countries from the destructive Comprehensive Sexuality Education introducedby pro-choice groups.

Unfortunately -- and unsurprisingly -- our enemies do not want these victories to go unpunished.

Our success in Spain led to the political establishment stripping our sister group of its status as a charitable organization, increasing the burden on its finances.

Our CitizenGO colleagues, Ann Kioko of Kenya and Caroline Farrow of the United Kingdom, are under personal attack for their principled and effective work as CitizenGO campaigners.

Ann is CitizenGO’s campaigns director for Africa. She has faced intense legal and media bullying for her strong pro-life and pro-family activism, especially for halting the operation of the world’s largest abortion provider in her home country.

She and her family have been followed, forcing them to relocate and take expensive security measures.

Caroline and her family in the U.K. face similar harassment and threats.

Her family and young children have been stalked online. A radical transgender activist is dragging her through an expensive, years-long court battle.

At one time, she even faced the threat of prison based on an outrageously false claim.

Thanks to a strong and generous response from CitizenGO supporters like you, we were able to shield Caroline and Ann from some of the worst impacts of these threats.

And now, CitizenGO is helping Caroline fight back with a hard-hitting countersuit to end the transgender’s harassment.

I hope it’s clear that it is the support of CitizenGOers like you which helps us persevere through all the setbacks and hardships, and you make our victories possible.

Will you stand with CitizenGO and support our efforts in the year ahead with a monthly financial contribution?

I will donate 10€

I will donate 30€

I will donate 80€

I will donate 160€

I will donate 300€

OTHER AMOUNT

Government agencies, media conglomerates, and massive entertainment companies have budgets that run into the billions of euros.

Fortunately, you and I don’t have to match them dollar for dollar.

Our grassroots organizational tactics have a proven history of success on much smaller budgets.

And while we might not have the budget of a government agency or a multinational corporation, we still have an ambitious agenda for the year ahead.

To list just a few of the important programs we are either planning or working on: 

  • Oppose and defund the radical pro-abortion and transgenderism agendas at the powerful United Nations and their World Health Organization;
  • Uphold our ongoing fight to end gender ideology indoctrination at Disney parks and in Disney films and productions;
  • Stop censorship of Christian, pro-Life, and pro-Liberty thought on Social Media and other online platforms
  • Fight back against filthy, blasphemous, and transgender propaganda on popular streaming services like Netflix; and
  • Continue to impact elections and legislation on behalf of life, family, and liberty.
  • Oppose the abortion and Surrogacy bills in the Kenyan Senate and National Assembly respectively.
  • Oppose tabling of the abortion bill in Malawi.
  • Protect African children from sexualization.
  • Protect the African family.
Will you take a stand for our shared values in the year ahead by becoming a monthly donor to CitizenGO today?

I will donate 10€

I will donate 30€

I will donate 80€

I will donate 160€

I will donate 300€

OTHER AMOUNT

It is my fervent prayer you will help CitizenGO finish strong this year and continue your support in the year ahead. Thanks a lot for all you do.

Ignacio Arsuaga

P.S. Everyone here at CitizenGO is working hard to meet our end-of-year deadlines and finalizing our plans for 2021, based on the responses CitizenGO members have sent us on the survey we sent out some days ago.

The following days and weeks will play a large role in shaping our programs in the year ahead.

So please agree to your monthly contribution today!
  

CitizenGO is a community of active citizens that works to ensure that human life, the family and our freedoms are respected worldwide. CitizenGO members live in every nation of the world. Our team is spread across 16 countries on 5 continents and operates in 12 languages. Learn about CitizenGO here or follow us on Facebook or Twitter.

This message is addressed to arnoldnderitu@gmail.com.

If you do not wish to receive emails from CitizenGO, click on this link. To ensure that CitizenGO messages reach your inbox, please add petitions-en@citizengo.org to your address book. To change your email address, language settings, or other personal information, contact us. To contact CitizenGO, please do not reply to this email. Instead, write to us at citizengo.org/en/contact.
